co_located_events.name: 32nd RCRA Workshop on Experimental Evaluation of Algorithms for Solving Problems with Combinatorial Explosion (RCRA 2025)
co_located_events.description: The scope of the workshop is fostering the cross-fertilization of ideas stemming from different areas, proposing benchmarks for new challenging problems, comparing models and algorithms from an experimental viewpoint.

co_located_events.name: 18th Workshop on Answer Set Programming and Other Computing Paradigms (ASPOCP 2025)
co_located_events.description: Workshop on combining Answer Set Programming with Other Computing Paradigms, such as constraint satisfaction and quantified Boolean formulas.

co_located_events.name: 12th Workshop on Probabilistic Logic Programming (PLP 2025)
co_located_events.description: The PLP workshop encompasses all aspects of combining logic, algorithms, programming, and probability.

co_located_events.name: 9th Workshop on Advances in Argumentation in Artificial Intelligence (AI³ 2025)
co_located_events.description: The goal of the workshop is to stimulate discussions and promote scientific collaboration among researchers involved in argumentation.

co_located_events.name: Third Prolog Education Workshop (PEG 2025)
co_located_events.description: The PEG workshop aims to promote the use of Prolog-like computing to make logical reasoning and trustworthy coding skills more universally available.

co_located_events.name: Second Annual Workshop on Prolog Improvement Proposals (PIPs)
co_located_events.description: The PIP workshop series offers Prolog implementers and users an opportunity to present features that could benefit other systems.

co_located_events.name: Workshop on Logic Programming and Legal Reasoning (LPLR 2025)
co_located_events.description: The aim of the workshop is to give the opportunity to legal experts and computer scientists to present recent research results in automating reasoning over legal documents.

co_located_events.name: 1st Workshop on Cognitive Architectures for Robotics: LLMs and Logic in Action (CARLA)
co_located_events.description: CARLA aims to advance the field of intelligent robotics through integration of large language models and logic.
